turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Iraqis in Syria.
turn.1: Why did Iraqis in Syria settle there?
turn.2: Large portions of Iraq's Christians and Sabean-Mandeans, in particular, have fled to Syria due to the targeting and dissolution of their urban communities in Iraq.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: The number of Palestinians in Iraq, which was around 30,000 prior to 2003, has also shriveled as well, with most settling in the Yarmouk neighborhood of Damascus until 2006, when the Syrian government chose to restrict their entry.
turn.5: Do they still settle in Syria?
turn.6: In 2007, Syrian officials estimated that 80% of Iraqi refugees in Syria were living in greater Damascus.
turn.7: What part of Syria did they settle in?
turn.8: The largest Iraqi communities are found in the southern suburbs of Jaramanah, which is largely Christian, and Sayyida Zaynab, a predominantly Shi'a neighborhood.
turn.9: Did they settle in any other parts of Syria?
turn.10: Damascene Iraqis also maintain a visible presence in Yarmouk and Qudsiyya.
turn.11: What other parts of Syria did they settle in?
turn.12: Many Sunnis, in particular, have been drawn to the northern municipalities of Aleppo, Homs, and Hama, while other Iraqis have settled in Tartus, Lattakia, Hasaka, Qamishli as well as the tribal areas of Deir ez-Zor and Abu Kemal.
